column4: Hello, yesterday i upgraded to Ubuntu 10.10 Netbook on my Eee PC 901, but i cannot get the Wireless network working?
You may have proprietary drivers. Make sure they're installed correctly.
: "There are no proprietary drivers in use on this system"
: when i search for drivers
Right-click the networking icon, make sure "Enable Wireless" is chcked.
: i only got to active normal network, not wireless. That might have something to do with it :D
You get it fixed then?
: don't know, but if there should both be a normal network and wireless in the menu, that's the first step i guess :D
: I'm kinda new, so i gotta find out how to activate it in the first place, but if i'm bothering you guys here with such simple questions it might be messed up :D
No worries, man, that's what we're here for.
Left-click on the networking icon on the top right of your screen. Does it show wireless networks now?
Damn. Might be a question for the guys at ubuntuforums.org. Very helpful people there, try that.
: iwconfig says no wireless extensions for lo and eth0
: i will try to see if it's disabled in BIOS
BIOS would have nothing to do with wireless.
eth0 is Ethernet and lo is something else.
: just went to BIOS and it actually HAD disabled the wireless.. , lets see if i can find my network now when booting up. 2 sec
How the hell? You must be running some odd system, mate, because BIOS shouldn't handle your wireless device. At that, I have to say "What the hell?"
: nice, now it connects :)
You're all set then. Enjoy, sir.
: hahaha :D odd system? :DD I only run Ubuntu 10.10 Netbook on this machine.. upgraded from Ubuntu 10.04 Netbook. But yea, thanks for your help :)
